title: [Large-scale] Constructivist-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Online and Distance Learning (ODL)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Experience in Using Online Learning Platforms
context.additional_context: A competency-building program for managers/leaders in corporate settings to design social sector job training. Operated in a BYOD environment with continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Design and submit three or more ODL (Open and Distance Learning) contents based on constructivist principles.

Learners develop a blended learning scenario (2 online + 1 offline sessions) that achieves an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale from two corporate training managers within 3 weeks. The scenario includes learner-centered activities (1 discussion, 1 collaborative task) and must meet the following criteria: 1) online sessions ≤ 60 minutes, 2) offline session ≤ 120 minutes, 3) discussion activity ≥ 30 minutes, 4) collaborative task performable in pairs.
Integrate an online discussion module and formative assessment tools for application in real corporate training cases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
